      • getAccessKey

        public int getAccessKey(java.lang.String localizedCode)
        Returns the access key code for the specified label or menu entry if any is defined. The access key code is an integer, representing an ASCII character. Normally only upper case characters should be used, but any valu between 32 (space) and 127 (DEL) is accepted.
        Parameters:
        localizedCode - localisation code for a label or menu entry
        Returns:
        coresponding access key code if any is defined, 0 otherwise.

      • isMacOSX

        public static boolean isMacOSX()
        Returns true if we are running on Mac OS X. To add some extra bells and whistles. And I thought Windows was a pain...!
        Returns:
        true if the current machine is a Mac

      • isWindows

        public static boolean isWindows()
        Gee, I never thought I'd do something like this. But ok, everything for the user experience.
        Returns:
        true if this box runs on win xy

      • getDefaultFileInfo

        public SwingConfig.DefaultFileInfo getDefaultFileInfo()
        Default file info displayed in the result table. See DefaultFileInfo for available options.
        Returns:
        Default file info displayed in the result table

      • setDefaultFileInfo

        public void setDefaultFileInfo(java.lang.String fileInfoCode)
        Sets the default file info using the code name. The parameter must correspond to one of the legal code names of enum class DefaultFileInfo}. Null values and illegal code names will be ignored
        Parameters:
        fileInfoCode - code name of class DefaultFileInfo.

      • isShowPlainBytes

        public boolean isShowPlainBytes()
        Returns true if plain byte values should be shown in Info column if the default file info property is set to "SIZE".
        Returns:
        true if plain byte values should be shown in Info column

      • setShowPlainBytes

        public void setShowPlainBytes(boolean showPlainBytes)
        Set to true if plain byte values should be shown in Info column if the default file info property is set to "SIZE".
        Parameters:
        showPlainBytes - true if plain byte values should be shown in Info column

      • setFocusTraversalKeys

        public void setFocusTraversalKeys(javax.swing.JComponent component)
        Sets the focus traversal keys TAB and SHIFT+TAB for the specified component. This is typically necessary for Textareas.
        Parameters:
        component - to receive the standard focus traversal keys
